data.meta_description: *Released Today!*Â Â Data Foundation & Deloitte surveyÂ finds that 95 percent of CDOs will consider implementing artificial intelligence technologies in the nextâ€¦
data.text:
Had a great Friday last week participating in Deloitteâ€™s Impact Day! For 25 years, #ImpactDay has been an incredible day of service and purpose at Deloitte. I was extremely proud to spend the day making NICU graduation caps with colleagues and our friends from March of Dimes. The day a family brings home their child from the NICU is a moment of immense joy and celebration, and these caps are a small but heartfelt way to commemorate that milestone. Thank you to Seth Shank , Sarah Burinsky , Brandon Gressett and our good friend Danielle Naman from MoD for organizing this fun and impactful event. I came to the event with low expectations of my craftiness, but was pleasently surprised by the results! (Thanks for the step by step instructions Seth and Sarah!) Looking forward to next yearâ€™s impact day and our continued collaboration with March of Dimes. Hereâ€™s to many more years of making a difference! #DeloitteImpactDay #MarchOfDimes

Very excited to participate in the Alliance for Health Policy 9th annual Signature Series on AI in Health kickoff as a member of a sponsoring organization at the Thought Leader Workshop on April 25th. We will be examining key themes with experts, industry leaders, patient groups and policymakers. With so many meetings on AI taking place, this one will have a unique focus on two strategic and practical questions: â€œWhat does a good AI advisory board look like?â€ And â€œWhat should the curriculum on AI be for policymakers?"

ğŸŒŸ In honor of Womenâ€™s History Month, Deloitteâ€™s Federal Health Practice is collaborating with Women in DataÂ® to host a Women in Federal Health Data Leadership webinar. ğŸ‘©ğŸ’¼ Meet our esteemed panelists: Dr. Susan Jenkins, Director of the Division of Evidence, Evaluation, and Data Policy within HHSâ€™ Office of Science and Data Policy, and HHS Evaluation Officer Dr. Tara Schwetz, NIH Deputy Director for Program Coordination, Planning, and Strategic Initiatives Dr. Catharine Young, Assistant Director of Cancer Moonshot Policy and International Engagement at the White House ğŸ’¬ This engaging webinar will delve into their experiences, insights, and the impact of women in shaping federal health data policies. ğŸ“… Save the Date: ğŸ—“ï¸ Wednesday, March 20th ğŸ•š 11:00 AM â€“ 12:00 PM ET ğŸ”— Secure your spot now! Register here: https://lnkd.in/ezMbci8U

Absolutely loved being back on campus for the day at my alma mater for the University of Maryland - Robert H. Smith School of Business AI Symposium on Design & Governance (https://lnkd.in/e3iCCk7K). Extremely grateful to Prabhudev Konana , Wedad Elmaghraby, and Balaji Padmanabhan for the gracious invitation, warm hospitality, and an incredible day. It was truly a pleasure sharing insights on AI trends in government and learning from the impressive lineup of speakers at the symposium. Looking forward to more collaborative endeavors ahead! #ai #FedHealthAIAcc

Excited to host cross-industry leaders from academia, health nonprofits, and government institutions as we delve into the potential of AI in enhancing health. Don't miss out on our panel discussions and working sessions where we will unearth the opportunities, risks, and considerations for implementing AI in Federal health. If you're interested in joining this enlightening conversation, please reach out. Let's explore the future of health together! Margaret Anderson (she/her) Juergen Klenk Matt Caccavale Ed Van Buren Beth Meagher
